Class Factory

Implements the logic for converting lines of text into instances of Behavior.

Inheritance
object
Factory
Inherited Members
object.Equals(object)
object.Equals(object, object)
object.GetHashCode()
object.GetType()
object.MemberwiseClone()
object.ReferenceEquals(object, object)
object.ToString()
Namespace: CTree
Assembly: Assembly-CSharp.dll
Syntax
public static class Factory
Remarks

Implements the logic for converting lines of text into behaviors. The set of built-in behaviors have the following syntax in the input file. Each line of input corresponds to a single behavior, created using one of the functions defined in this class.

Control Nodes

  • Sequence(World, string)
  • Parallel(World, string)
  • Select(World, string)
  • Repeat(World, string)
  • RepeatWhile(World, string)
  • If(World, string)
  • IfDrag(World, string)
  • IfDrop(World, string)
  • IfClick(World, string)
  • IfHover(World, string)
  • IfMouseOver(World, string)

State Nodes

  • SetState(World, string)
  • Add(World, string)

Appearance Nodes

  • Wait(World, string)
  • Show(World, string)
  • Hide(World, string)
  • PlayAnimation(World, string)
  • StopAnimation(World, string)
  • SetText(World, string)
  • Fade(World, string)
  • Grow(World, string)
  • ChangeColor(World, string)
  • RevertColor(World, string)
  • Move(World, string)
  • Pulse(World, string)

Methods

Add(World, string)

Creates a behavior that modifies a global integer variable

Declaration
public static Behavior Add(World world, string args)
Parameters
Type Name Description
World world

Object for accessing global state.
string args

Parameters for the behavior
Returns
Type Description
Behavior

An instance of behavior
Remarks

Implements the following input string

Add: VariableName, Delta

For example, Add: StarCount, 1 will add one to the variable StarCount stored in World. The behavior completes in one frame.

ChangeColor(World, string)

Creates a behavior that changes an asset's color.

Declaration
public static Behavior ChangeColor(World w, string config)
Parameters
Type Name Description
World w
string config
Returns
Type Description
Behavior

An instance of behavior
Remarks

Implements the following input string

ChangeColor: AssetName, R, G, B, Duration

For example, ChangeColor: Star, 1, 0, 0, 2.0 will change the color of Star to the color (1,0,0), or Red. Colors should be in the range 0 and 1. The duration indicates the length of the transition. The first time ChangeColor is called, we cache the original colors s we can revert them later.

Create(World, string)

Given world and input text, creates a behavior

Declaration
public static Behavior Create(World world, string config)
Parameters
Type Name Description
World world

Object for accessing global state.
string config

A string with format FnName:Args
Returns
Type Description
Behavior

An instance of behavior
Remarks

The format for input is FnName:Args, where FnName corresponds to a static function defined in Factory. Args is a string that contains any parameters that is needed to initialize the behavior.

Fade(World, string)

Creates a behavior that changes the transparency of an asset

Declaration
public static Behavior Fade(World w, string config)
Parameters
Type Name Description
World w
string config
Returns
Type Description
Behavior

An instance of behavior
Remarks

Implements the following input string

Fade: AssetName, StartAlpha, EndAlpha, Duration

For example, Fade: Star, 0, 1, 2.0 will change the transparency of the asset Star from 0 (invisible) to 1 (opaque) over 2 seconds.

Declaration
public static Behavior Grow(World w, string config)
Parameters
Type Name Description
World w
string config
Returns
Type Description
Behavior

An instance of behavior
Remarks

Implements the following input string

Grow: AssetName, StartSize, EndSize, Duration

For example, Grow: Star, 1, 2, 4.0 will increase the size of the asset Star from its original size to twice the size over 4.0 seconds.

Behavior

Remarks

Implements the following input string

Hide: AssetName

For example, Hide: Squirrel will hide the geometry associated with Squirrel and disable its associaed components.

If(World, string)

Creates a behavior that executes a set of behaviors if the conditional is true

Declaration
public static Behavior If(World world, string args)
Parameters
Type Name Description
World world

Object for accessing global state.
string args

Parameters for specifying the conditional
Returns
Type Description
Behavior

An instance of behavior
Remarks

The behavior completes immediately if the conditional is false. If the condition is true, the behavior completes when all sub-behaviors complete. All sub-behaviors run in parallel.

If: Solved, 1
  DoStuff
End

IfClick(World, string)

Creates a behavior that executes a set of behaviors if the conditional is true

Declaration
public static Behavior IfClick(World world, string args)
Parameters
Type Name Description
World world

Object for accessing global state.
string args

Parameters for specifying the conditional
Returns
Type Description
Behavior

An instance of behavior
Remarks

Executes all sub-behaviors in parallel if the user clicks the given scene object. Otherwise, the condition is false and the behavior completes immediately.

IfClick: AssetName
   DoStuff
End

Creates a behavior that executes a set of behaviors if the conditional is true

string args

Parameters for specifying the conditional
Returns
Type Description
Behavior

An instance of behavior
Remarks

Executes all sub-behaviors in parallel if the user picks up the give object. Otherwise, the condition is false and the behavior completes immediately.

IfDrag: AssetName
   DoStuff
End

IfDrop(World, string)

Creates a behavior that executes a set of behaviors if the conditional is true

Declaration
public static Behavior IfDrop(World world, string args)
Parameters
Type Name Description
World world

Object for accessing global state.
string args

Parameters for specifying the conditional
Returns
Type Description
Behavior

An instance of behavior
Remarks

Executes all sub-behaviors in parallel if the user drops the specified asset on another asset. Otherwise, the condition is false and the behavior completes immediately.

IfDrop: PickUpAsset, DropTarget
   DoStuff
End

IfHover(World, string)

Creates a behavior that executes a set of behaviors if the conditional is true

Declaration
public static Behavior IfHover(World world, string args)
Parameters
Type Name Description
World world

Object for accessing global state.
string args

Parameters for specifying the conditional
Returns
Type Description
Behavior

An instance of behavior
Remarks

Executes all sub-behaviors in parallel if the user hovers one object on top of another object (e.g. if their two colliders overlap). Otherwise, the condition is false and the behavior completes immediately.

IfHover: PickUpAsset, DropTarget
   DoStuff
End

IfMouseOver(World, string)

Creates a behavior that executes a set of behaviors if the conditional is true

Declaration
public static Behavior IfMouseOver(World world, string args)
Parameters
Type Name Description
World world

Object for accessing global state.
string args

Parameters for specifying the conditional
Returns
Type Description
Behavior

An instance of behavior
Remarks

Executes all sub-behaviors in parallel if the user hovers the mouse over the specified scene object. Otherwise, the condition is false and the behavior completes immediately.

IfMouseOver: AssetName
   DoStuff
End

Move(World, string)

Creates a behavior that moves an asset (both position and rotation) between two waypoints.

Declaration
public static Behavior Move(World w, string config)
Parameters
Type Name Description
World w
string config
Returns
Type Description
Behavior

An instance of behavior
Remarks

Implements the following input string

Move: AssetName, Waypoint1, Waypoint2, Duration, InterpolationType

For example, Move: Star, Waypoint1, Waypoint2, Duration, Cosine will animate asset Star so it starts with the position and rotation of Waypoint1 and ends with the position and rotation of Waypoint2. The Duration is the length of the transition in seconds. The InterpolationType is optional and specifies the shape of the curve between the start and end points. Supported choices for InterpolationType are "Linear", "Cosine", and "EaseIn". The default is "Linear".

Parallel(World, string)

Creates a behavior that implements parallel control.

Declaration
public static Behavior Parallel(World w, string message)
Parameters
Type Name Description
World w
string message

Unused
Returns
Type Description
Behavior

An instance of behavior
Remarks

This behavior maintains a list of sub-behaviors that are executed simultaneously. The block of behaviors completes once all sub-behaviors complete. For example,

Parallel:
   SubBehavior1
   SubBehavior2
End

PlayAnimation(World, string)

Creates a behavior that plays an animation

Declaration
public static Behavior PlayAnimation(World w, string config)
Parameters
Type Name Description
World w
string config
Returns
Type Description
Behavior

An instance of behavior
Remarks

Implements the following input string

PlayAnimation: AssetName, AnimationName

For example, PlayAnimation: Squirrel, Dance plays the dance animation on the asset Squirrel. The behavior completes when the animation is complete.

Pulse(World, string)

Creates a behavior that pulses the size of an asset.

Declaration
public static Behavior Pulse(World world, string args)
Parameters
Type Name Description
World world

Object for accessing global state.
string args

Parameters for the behavior
Returns
Type Description
Behavior

An instance of behavior
Remarks

Implements the following input string

Pulse: AssetName, NumTimes, PulseSpeed, PulseGrowth

For example, Pulse: Star, 2, 0.4, 0.1 will pulse the asset Star twice. Each pulse will last 0.4 seconds and will increase the size by 10%. The PulseSpeed and PulseGrowth are option. The default PulseSpeed is 0.4 seconds. The default PulseGrowth is 0.1, or 10%.

Repeat(World, string)

Creates a behavior that repeats a set of behaviors

Declaration
public static Behavior Repeat(World world, string args)
Parameters
Type Name Description
World world

Object for accessing global state.
string args

Unused
Returns
Type Description
Behavior

An instance of behavior
Remarks

This behavior maintains a list of sub-behaviors that run in parallel. For example,

Repeat:
   SubBehavior1
   SubBehavior2
End

RepeatWhile(World, string)

Creates a behavior that repeats behaviors for as long as the condition remains true

Declaration
public static Behavior RepeatWhile(World world, string args)
Parameters
Type Name Description
World world

Object for accessing global state.
string args

Unused
Returns
Type Description
Behavior

An instance of behavior
Remarks

This behavior maintains a list of sub-behaviors that run in parallel. For example,

RepeatWhile: VariableName, 0
   SubBehavior1
   SubBehavior2
   IfClick: AssetName
      # Changes state so we exit and finish the behavior
      SetState: VariableName, 1
   End
End

RevertColor(World, string)

Creates a behavior that reverts to an asset's original color.

Declaration
public static Behavior RevertColor(World w, string config)
Parameters
Type Name Description
World w
string config
Returns
Type Description
Behavior

An instance of behavior
Remarks

Implements the following input string

RevertColor: AssetName, Duration

For example, RevertColor: Star will revert the color of the asset Star to its original color, over the given duration.

Select(World, string)

Creates a behavior that selects one behavior of a set to execute

Declaration
public static Behavior Select(World world, string args)
Parameters
Type Name Description
World world

Object for accessing global state.
string args

Unused
Returns
Type Description
Behavior

An instance of behavior
Remarks

This behavior maintains a list of sub-behaviors where the first sub-behavior to return tree is executed.

Select:
   If: HasKey, 1
      OpenCade
   End
   If: HasKey, 0
      CloseDoor
   End
End

Parameters
Type Name Description
World world

Object for accessing global state.
string dummy

Unused
Returns
Type Description
Behavior

An instance of behavior
Remarks

This behavior maintains a list of sub-behaviors that are executed in sequence. The block of behaviors completes once all sub-behaviors complete. For example,

Sequence:
   SubBehavior1
   SubBehavior2
End

SetState(World, string)

Creates a behavior that sets the value of a global variable

Declaration
public static Behavior SetState(World world, string dummy)
Parameters
Type Name Description
World world

Object for accessing global state.
string dummy
Returns
Type Description
Behavior

An instance of behavior
Remarks

Implements the following input string

SetState: VariableName, VariableValue

For example, SetState: Solved, 1 will set the global variable (stored in World) with name Solved to 1.
The behavior completes in one frame.

Creates a behavior that changes the text on an object.

Declaration
public static Behavior SetText(World world, string config)
Parameters
Type Name Description
World world

Object for accessing global state.
string config
Returns
Type Description
Behavior

An instance of behavior
Remarks

Implements the following input string

SetText: AssetName, NewText

For example, SetText: UItext, Hello, World! will set the contents of UIText to the string "Hello, World!" The behavior completes in one frame.

Returns

Behavior

An instance of behavior
Remarks

Implements the following input string

Show: AssetName

For example, Show: Squirrel enables the GameObjet with name Squirrel. This will show the asset's geometry and activate any components on it.

For example, StopAnimation: Squirrel, Dance stops the dance animation for Squirrel.

Wait(World, string)

Creates a behavior that waits for a specified amount of time (e.g. pauses)

Declaration
public static Behavior Wait(World world, string args)
Parameters
Type Name Description
World world

Object for accessing global state.
string args

Parameters for the behavior
Returns
Type Description
Behavior

An instance of behavior
Remarks

Implements the following input string

Wait: Duration

For example, Wait: 1.0 pauses for one second. The behavior completes when the duration as passed.
